We are working with the file combined_gapMinder.tsv.
```{r setup, echo=F}
#Get data
gap.in <- read.table("output//combined_gapMinder.tsv", header=T, sep="\t")

#Load library
library(dplyr)
```

The countries in this file are:
```{r see-countries, echo=FALSE}
levels(gap.in$country)
```

```{r limit_countries, echo=FALSE}
#Pick the 3 countries I want to use
gap.3 <- filter(gap.in, country %in% c("Brazil", "Guinea", "United States")) %>% droplevels()
```

There are distinct trends in GDP over time in `r levels(gap.3$country)`
```{r GDP-plots, echo=FALSE}
#Plot GDP as a function of year
par(mfrow=c(1, 3))
with(filter(gap.3, country=="Brazil"), plot(year, gdpPercap, main="", xlab="Year", ylab="Per capita GDP"))
with(filter(gap.3, country=="Guinea"), plot(year, gdpPercap, main="Per Capita GDP for Three Countries", xlab="Year", ylab="Per capita GDP"))
with(filter(gap.3, country=="United States"), plot(year, gdpPercap, main="", xlab="Year", ylab="Per capita GDP"))

```
